headline: Tomato and Mozzarella Bites
description: These tomato and mozzarella bites with fresh basil and a balsamic dip are a great way to serve Italian caprese salad as a fun party appetizer!
name: Tomato and Mozzarella Bites
recipeIngredient: 20 small balls fresh mozzarella cheese (often labeled bocconcini)

recipeInstructions.text: Thread a tomato half, a basil leaf, a mozzarella ball, and another tomato half onto a toothpick. Repeat with remaining ingredients.
Arrange toothpicks on a serving platter and season with salt and pepper.
Mix vinegar and oil together in a small bowl to serve as a dipping sauce.

review.reviewBody: I have made it many times over the years. My husband, who does not cook, can even prepare it. I purchase Balsamic Glaze and drizzle it on.
These are surprisingly addicting. Easy to make and so fresh and delicious.
Added a garlic stuffed olive to the middle.

The perfect appetizer. Simple, quick, tastes great and can easily be adjusted for any size crowd.
Couldn't be better.

So darn good! This is a treat for us and it goes quickly. Costco sells balsamic glaze that is thicker and very good. Be very sure your tomatoes are good... 1 bad tomato & kids will never trust a tomato again. Lol
Easy and has a great presentation.
No changes. Was perfect and gone in a flash. Thanks!!!
I made them for Xmas Eve. They looked very festive. They were easy and delicious.
I used a balsamic glace for dressing, turned out very good!

Made these for two gatherings. The second I made one batch adding salami - they were a hit! The only challenge is the dressing recipe makes too much, so I've scaled it down after the first time I made these. A definite favorite addition to future gatherings!
This was big hit at our neighborhood block party...I did heat the balsamic vinegar until it started to thicken and then drizzle it over the skewers,...I will make it again soon.

I drizzled evoo over the plate, sprinkled with dry Italian herbs, fresh ground black pepper and sea salt. Delicious and a big hit. I used an assortment of tomatoes from my garden, yellow pear, red pear, orange grape, red cherry, made for a very pretty presentation. This recipe is a keeper. Sorry I didn't take a photo
Elegant and perfect for an appetizer! I made these on longer skewers. Be careful! It's hard to stop eating these. They're so delicious!

Make a balsamic reduction, which is fancy talk for cooking some of the moisture out of the vinegar. I thickens up and makes the kitchen smell amazing. Drizzle that over your kabobs and you will think of heaven itself.
Light, fresh, satisfying. Added garlic....loved them.
Loved these little guys! I used balsamic glaze (reduction) instead of the vinegar and oil. So yummy and a beautiful display of color on the food table too.
So easy to make, everyone loved, them...I did use fresh basil on most of them, as it has a strong flavour(which I loved) I used spinach on a few instead for those that may not like basil
Super easy and really good. Sprinkled them with the olive oil and balsamic versus making a dipping sauce.
My mom and I made this for a party once and she added a piece of sausage to it
Simple, beautiful and very tasty!
Very yummy, easy snack! Could use a little extra zip maybe.
Perfect for what we needed: quick, easy and delicious! They went fast and we got a ton of compliments.
No changes, it perfect the way it is!
Fantastic! The skewer made it that much better for an appetizer.

Absolutely delicious!!! I wanted to take something semi-healthy to a potluck where pizza was the main course and these fit perfectly. They were quick and easy to make and very colorful! I used the idea of another reviewer who suggested using marinated mozzarella from Trader Joe's -- it was amazing! I also used the "marinade" from the mozzarella tub to dribble on top instead of just using olive oil!!! Yum!
Very Very Tasty!!!!!!
Love these. So easy and elegant.

My family loves this! I did change a few things though...I added a teaspoon of diced garlic and substituted cilantro for the basil as I was fresh out of basil, whisked it together with olive oil and traditional balsamic reduction and it was soooo yummy! I liked it better than the original version actually. I also mixed the cherry tomatoes (uncut) together with the mozzarella balls in a bowl and poured the marinade over everything and refrigerated it for about an hour letting the mozzarella soak up the marinade. Served as a side dish. Delicious!!!

I followed the recipe nearly to the 'T'...I did not have the fresh basil, which was a concern, but I had dried basil. I made the appetizer itself first, then sprinkled it with the dried basil. As far as the 'dipping' sauce, I used a basting brush and brushed them lightly with the mixture. My company loved them! Thank you for the recipe!
Very yummy!
Easy, elegant and tasty. I make a balsamic reduction and drizzle over and on the side for dipping if desired. Another staple to my holiday (and summer) parties.
Would give a higher rating but a little pain to make with the toothpick etc.. Everyone loved it!
Everyone loved these and they are very simple to make
Very good! I just used marinated mozzarella balls, cut in half - added the cherry tomatoes to the mozzarella marinade - then assembled.
These are delicious! I sprinkled hand ground cracked black pepper on them for an added taste. Everyone raved about them. There were none left at the company potluck.
I made this for a girl's night. It was a hit. I had no leftovers. GREAT recipe!

I made these for a wedding, and they weren't horrible, but definitely seemed lacking in flavor. I've made them a few times since then, with a few changes that really made the flavors explode in your mouth. Grilling or roasting the tomatoes brings out a sweet, savory taste, and marinating the mozzarella (or buying it already marinated) adds more flavor.

I thought these were terrific. Like another reviewer, I bought Trader Joe's marinated mozzarella balls so I didn't need to make the dressing. I also added a small piece of salted pork (thick bacon) to the mix. It gave it additional flavor, crunch and saltiness that my guests really enjoyed. I put half a tomato & half a mozzarella ball with a small basil & the bacon on a tooth pick. Made a great small bite!

I love this recipe. When the local store in my small town was out of basil I used Herbes de Provence (Frontier brand was excellent, Victoria Taylor's is great too). I make a little salad for myself using the mini bocconcini, halved cherry or grape tomatoes, olive oil, torn basil leaves or Herbes de Provence. After letting it sit for at least ten minutes I grind sea salt over it. Soooo good.
Fresh basil makes this a very light and tasty appetizer. I use pre marinated mozerella balls if I can find them, otherwise marimate them myself in the dressing

Pretty. Add olive or a cold tortellini
, cheese
this was easy to make and tasted great. I just made a couple for an appetizer for a dinner for 2
This was easy, filling, and good. A good light dinner, maybe with a good bread.

Turned out very good. I made these for a Halloween Party and everyone loved them. I used cherry tomatoes, mozzarella balls and sprinkled basil with a little salt and pepper on top. I did not have basil leaves so I just used what I had in my spice cabinet. They all turned out very good and the display was eye catching. Thanks for a great appetizer.
Very much loved!
Yum! Easy and delicious. I put a little chopped basil and some salt and pepper into the vinegar and oil mixture. I think bottled balsamic vinaigrette would be good as a dipping sauce too.

Lizzy did not like the Basil
No one really used the dipping sauce
Good on it's own

These were a simple but elegant addition to a plate of small bites for a tea party. I used the marinated mozzarella from Trader Joe's, and poured the liquid over the assembled skewers in place of the balsamic/olive oil mixture. Very easy and very popular!
me and my friends loved the receipe! easy to make and fun to eat

These are ALWAYS a hit when I make them. I am always asked for the recipe and most people are shocked at how easy these are to make. So much better than the traditional tomato and mozzarella which must be eaten with a fork and knife. I have never needed the dipping sauce - I put the marinade over the bites and let it marinate overnight. When the balsamic and oil absorbs into the bites - it's that much more heavenly. Try it and see - you won't be disappointed!
good, but it is what it is. Tomato, basil, cheese. The dressing helped. It looked great, but to really love this, you really have to love the ingredients.
Perfect for a Christmas pot luck party!
Tasted good but they were a lot of work to put together
I made this with 3 different colored and types of bite sized tomatoes and the little tiny mozzarella balls. Sooo good and lots of requests for the recipe
Drizzled some balsamic vinegar over it. I love them and they last in the fridge for a couple days. Perfect thing to bring to a summer BBQ.
Nice looking presentation for a dinner party.
Nothing special. I found the dressing bland
Yum! I served with olive oil & balsamic vinegar
I could eat a ton of these!
Really good!! Even my husband who hates vinegar, loved this. I use it as a marinade, used spinach leaves instead of basil, and brought it to camp!

I had these at a pals grand opening and I was blown away! She didn't use the dipping idea though. She just drizzled it with the oil and vinegar and I thought that was a wise choice. The fewer things out in a large party like that the better.
Excellent

Love this recipe! Made only a few minor changes: instead of toothpicks I had my husband cut some wooden skewers into approx 4" lengths. Skewer a small mozzarella ball (or a piece of a cut-up larger ball) first. Follow with a small leaf of basil (or a piece of a larger leaf. Finish with a half a cherry tomato with the cut side down. Instead of the O&V, I use balsamic glaze (Sophia's comes in a squirt top plastic bottle). I drizzle the glaze back and forth over a large white china platter and stand the skewers on it, evenly spaced. The cut tomatoes provide a stable base. You can sprinkle with a little sea salt and fresh cracked pepper then cover with some plastic wrap to keep from drying out. Using half a tomato and small ball of mozz makes this a one bite app - easier to manage and less messy than a longer skewer with multiple tomatoes, cheese etc. The colors pop and it all looks a bit more gourmet - a huge hit whenever I make it - and a healthy alternative to chips and dip etc.

I made these for a cookout last weekend and they were devoured. I sprinkled course sea salt on the dish and then arranged the skewers on top of the salt. Then I drizzled the dipping sauce over the entire plate. These are so delish! I'm making them again this weekend for a baby shower. Don't skimp on the good mozarella! It's worth it! Thanks for the great recipe.

My book club group loved this.

Here are my modifications:
1. I marinated the cheese balls in the olive oil (my grocery store carries a combo of olive oil, grape seed oil and canola oil) along with some citrus/basil garlic spice (from Pampered Chef) for a couple of hours.
2. Then afterward I put the rest together on the skewers. I did cut a couple of the cheese balls in half so I had enough to go with the tomatoes.
3. Poured some more olive oil and the spice over the top of the skewers when I served them.

Served for my book club meeting and everyone loved this.

These were a hit at our Memorial Day picnic. I used Polly o string cheese, cut into 1 inch pieces to cut back on cost. I made around 70 of these & they did not dry out or turn brown. I did marinate them over night & left out an hour or so before serving so the olive oil would not be so thick. Everyone loved them. I will be making again. Thanks for a great recipe.

Easy to do. Used already marinated in pesto mozzarella balls. Omitted the vinegar. Drizzled oil salt and pepper over assembled dish and it was a delightfully refreshing appetizer for Memorial Holiday. Colorful too.
Excellent, easy...got rave reviews at the BBQ today!

I made these when company was coming, only problem I didn't have any Mozzarella balls, I took a package of shredded Mozzarella 1/4 pack of fresh shredded Parmesan cheese, nuked it a few seconds in the microwave stirred it into one large ball and cut small pieces and assembled it the same way. Everyone said it tasted much better than the way they made them and wanted to know how or what brand I used.

I made this for a birthday party and they were a hit! Costco has a container of small mozzarella balls in marinade so I drained the marinade off and went on with the recipe. Very simple and very pretty. If the cherry or grape tomatoes are too large, which some of mine were, just cut them in half and put the cut side against the basil.
This was a great idea....super tasty...everyone loved them!!
Yummy, and very nice looking.
A classy and delicious appetizer!

I made this appetizer for a party and it was a hit. I made my own balsamic vinaigrette with 2 cloves crushed garlic, 1/2 tsp salt mashed together with garlic, add 3 tbl balsamic vinegar and wisk in 1/2 cup olive oil. Drizzle over tomato and mozzarella and leave extra for dipping. YUM!

I don' like to change a recipe and then rate it but all I changed was the technique and not the ingredients. I wanted to use this as more of a salad so I cut the tomatoes in half and then in very thin slices and then threw in some bocconccini balls that I cut in half. I didn't have fresh basil so I just used my freeze dried stuff and sprinkled it on top of the tomatoes and cheese. I mixed up the dressing and poured some of it over and gently mixed it just a few minutes before serving it. Yummy. The dressing and basil are what make this delicious. I would use grape or cherry tomatoes if I had them next time. I love how versatile this recipe is. It can be an appetizer or a salad.
Hubby loved it.
quick, easy & delicious!@
A very quick, easy and inexpensive appetizer for dinner nights!
So yummy and they look beautiful!

quick and simple!
a great last mintue, easy prep starter!
I actually mix this up in a bowl and treat it as a salad. Absolutely yummy (and easy). Always a crowd pleaser!

Really enjoyed these. I added watermelon. Takes a bit of time to assemble. Did the watermelon and the cheese the day before then added the basil and tomato before serving. Had cut the tomatoes in half and were soaking cut side down in balsamic vinaigrette overnight. Added pepper on the non-presentation side and salted the up side. Big hit-

Excellent! Made this today for a family party...it was a hot day and this was the perfect appetizer. It not only makes an eye pleasing dish, but is delicious! This dish was gone in minutes. I definitely would recommend this!

Fantastic without changes, although I prefer to sprinkle the oil and vinegar over the skewered cheese and tomatoes so they can absorb the flavor before serving. When you are in a real hurry, you can toss all the ingredients in a bowl for a "spoon it up" salad. The toothpick presentation is great, though.

Super easy and a big hit both times I've brought these to parties! People loved the presentation of it and it's easy to munch on while standing around. The second time I made them, I used another reviewer's idea to use extra basil leaves as garnish on the serving plate. It looked very festive!
these certainly don't last long at a party! very yummy!
You can't get any easier than this. I used a balsamic glaze versus the vinegar and it was very good. Keeper!
a keeper
Fantastic ! My family requests it !!!
This is simple and pretty. I bought a large container of Mozzarella cheese in an olive oil and herb marinade.

These are so tasty and easy to make! After assembling them (I use a single tomato per toothpick, and keep it whole), I drizzle the batch with good quality olive oil and sprinkle with salt and freshly ground pepper. This is one of my go-to appetizers!
Love this! Perfect for parties because they are easy to eat!
